result.execSummary:
The defendant Orrin D Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/DNA Surcharge to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 1/01/2017 or penalty of 7 days Huber for non-payment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

ADDRESS INFO for Orrin D Edwards
Current: 2955 N. Sherman Blvd, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 11-22-2016)
Prior: 8945 W Monrovia Ave, Apt.1, Milwaukee, WI 53225 United States
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Orrin D Edwards in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following to count #2:

FINE: $542.00

DNA Surcharge: $200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 1/1/2017.  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 7 days in Huber 

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Orrin D Edwards in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner advises his client is enrolled in a 6 month treatment program.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received May 26, 2016, dated May 26, 2016 from ADA Woller, adjournment request
Received May 20, 2016,   State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant appeared late.

Court recalled this case at 1:33 pm from the original time this morning based on the request of Attorney Weitzner.  Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Orrin D Edwards still did not appear.   Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to the nonappearance of the defendant, court revokes/forfeits bail.  Court issues a capias, cashbail in the amount of $500.00.  Case called for the Third time today at 2:   DEFENDANT APPEARED LATE.  Court quashes capias, reinstates bail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Orrin D Edwards did not appear.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions the nonappearance of the defendant.  Attorney Weitzner moves to stay a warrant for this afternoon.  Court adjourns this matter until 1:30 pm this afternoon.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
